stars.name: sun
stars.description: The Sun is the star at the center of the Solar System. It is a nearly perfect sphere of hot plasma, emitting light and energy.
interesting_facts: The Sun accounts for 99.86% of the mass in the Solar System.
The Sun's energy is generated through nuclear fusion in its core, where hydrogen is converted into helium.

planets.name: mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the smallest and closest planet to the Sun. It has a rocky surface and a thin atmosphere. Mercury experiences extreme temperature variations.
interesting_facts: Mercury has the largest daily temperature variations of any planet in the Solar System.
Mercury has no moons and no substantial atmosphere.

planets.name: venus
planets.description: Venus is the second planet from the Sun. It has a dense atmosphere and extremely high surface temperatures, making it the hottest planet in the Solar System.
interesting_facts: Venus has the longest day of any planet in the Solar System.
Venus's atmosphere is mostly carbon dioxide and creates a greenhouse effect that traps heat on the surface.

planets.name: earth
planets.description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only known celestial body to support life. It has a diverse environment and abundant water resources.
interesting_facts: Earth is the only planet in the Solar System known to have liquid water on its surface.
Earth has a natural satellite, the Moon, which plays a significant role in stabilizing its axis and creating tides.

planets.name: mars
planets.description: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun. It has a thin atmosphere and a reddish appearance due to iron oxide on its surface.
interesting_facts: Mars is home to the tallest volcano and the deepest, longest canyon in the Solar System.
Mars has polar ice caps made of water and carbon dioxide.

planets.name: jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun and the largest planet in the Solar System. It is mainly composed of gases and does not have a distinct surface. Jupiter has numerous moons and distinct atmospheric bands.
interesting_facts: Jupiter has the most moons of any planet in the Solar System - currently known to have over 70.
Jupiter has a great red spot - a massive storm that has been ongoing for at least 300 years.

planets.name: saturn
planets.description: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and is known for its prominent ring system. It is a gas giant with a yellowish hue.
interesting_facts: Saturn's rings are made up of ice particles with varying sizes, ranging from tiny grains to large chunks.
Saturn is the least dense planet in the Solar System and could float on water if a sufficiently large body of water were available.

planets.name: career
planets.composition: Primarily hydrogen and helium, with a small amount of ice
planets.description: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and is known for its unique tilt on its axis. It has a bluish-green color and a turbulent atmosphere.
interesting_facts: Uranus is often referred to as the "sideways planet" due to its extreme axial tilt, which is practically parallel to the plane of its orbit.
Uranus has extremely cold temperatures and a very windy atmosphere.

planets.name: neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the eighth and farthest planet from the Sun. It is a gas giant with a distinct blue color. It has a turbulent atmosphere and moons.
interesting_facts: Neptune has the strongest winds of any planet in the Solar System, reaching speeds of over 2,000 km/h.
Neptune has a Great Dark Spot - a massive atmospheric storm larger than Earth.
